# What is MLflow?

## FOSS and compatible {.center}

works with any ML or DL framework
any hyperparameter tuning framework (e.g. [integration](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/ml/traditional-ml/tutorials/hyperparameter-tuning/notebooks/hyperparameter-tuning-with-child-runs/) with [Optuna](https://github.com/optuna/optuna), [integration](https://docs.ray.io/en/latest/tune/examples/tune-mlflow.html) with [Ray Tune](https://github.com/ray-project/ray), [integration](https://mlflow.org/docs/3.1.3/ml/getting-started/hyperparameter-tuning/) with [hyperopt](https://github.com/hyperopt/hyperopt)
combine with [dvc](https://dvc.org/) for [dataset versioning](https://dev.to/aws-builders/ml-done-right-versioning-datasets-and-models-with-dvc-mlflow-4p3f)

## Platform for AI life cycle {.center}

![](../img/mlflow_model_dev.png)

this webinar focuses on experiment tracking

## Limitations {.center}

[MLflow projects](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/ml/projects/#environment) do not (yet) support [uv](https://docs.astral.sh/uv/)

some functionality missing for deployment and production for large companies (but irrelevant for research and no FOSS option exists)

## Installing MLflow {.center}

:::{.info}

`uv` not officially supported and might come issues. In case of problem, use official method with `pip` \
Don't call your script `mlflow.py` if you install with `uv` as it causes [unexpected behaviours](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/18387)

:::

```{.bash}
uv init --bare
uv add mlflow
```

## Log tracking data {.center}

```{.python}
import mlflow

with mlflow.start_run():
    mlflow.log_param("lr", 0.001)
    # Your ml code
    ...
    mlflow.log_metric("val_loss", val_loss)
```

## Visualize logged data {.center}

Can run on multiple platforms or locally

Local tracking data:

```{.bash}
uv run mlflow ui --port 5000
```

Remote tracking data (team development), launch a tracking server:

```{.bash}
uv run mlflow server --host 127.0.0.1 --port 5000
```

In both cases, open <http://127.0.0.1:5000> in your browser

:::{.note}

You can choose any unused port

:::
